focus-visible:outline-offset-[-4px]" dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-87" data-scroll-anchor="false"><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT said:</h6><div class="m-auto text-base py-[18px] px-6"><div class="mx-auto flex flex-1 gap-4 text-base md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 md:max-w-3xl lg:max-w-[40rem] xl:max-w-[48rem]"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn @xs/thread:px-0 @sm/thread:px-1.5 @md/thread:px-4"><div class="flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col flex-grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="d8a7cde9-7132-46e3-b9ff-61d784511bd8" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 whitespace-normal break-words text-start [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="257">If you want to find the <code data-start="24" data-end="35">number_id</code> that <strong data-start="41" data-end="60">exactly matches</strong> a <strong data-start="63" data-end="114">given list of prime factors and their exponents</strong>, you can use a dynamic SQL query. Below is a <strong data-start="160" data-end="183">generalized version</strong> where you can <strong data-start="198" data-end="244">pass a list of prime factors and exponents</strong> dynamically.</p><hr data-start="259" data-end="262"><h3 data-start="264" data-end="320"><strong data-start="268" data-end="320">SQL Query (Using an Input List of Prime Factors)</strong></h3><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="321" data-end="1065"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">sql</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-sql"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">WITH</span> GivenFactors <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> (
    <span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> <span class="hljs-number">2</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> prime_id, <span class="hljs-number">3</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> exponent <span class="hljs-keyword">UNION</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">ALL</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>
),
MatchingNumbers <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> (
    <span class="hljs-comment">-- Find number_id values that contain at least the given prime factors</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> pf.number_id
    <span class="hljs-keyword">FROM</span> PrimeFactors pf
    <span class="hljs-keyword">JOIN</span> GivenFactors gf <span class="hljs-keyword">ON</span> pf.prime_id <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> gf.prime_id <span class="hljs-keyword">AND</span> pf.exponent <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> gf.exponent
    <span class="hljs-keyword">GROUP</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">BY</span> pf.number_id
    <span class="hljs-keyword">HAVING</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">COUNT</span>(<span class="hljs-operator">*</span>) <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">COUNT</span>(<span class="hljs-operator">*</span>) <span class="hljs-keyword">FROM</span> GivenFactors)  <span class="hljs-comment">-- Ensure all given factors exist</span>
)
<span class="hljs-comment">-- Ensure the candidate number_id contains only the given factors</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> mn.number_id
<span class="hljs-keyword">FROM</span> MatchingNumbers mn
<span class="hljs-keyword">WHERE</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">NOT</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">EXISTS</span> (
    <span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> <span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">FROM</span> PrimeFactors pf
    <span class="hljs-keyword">WHERE</span> pf.number_id <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> mn.number_id
    <span class="hljs-keyword">AND</span> (pf.prime_id, pf.exponent) <span class="hljs-keyword">NOT</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">IN</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> prime_id, exponent <span class="hljs-keyword">FROM</span> GivenFactors)
);
</span></code></div></div></pre><hr data-start="1067" data-end="1070"><h3 data-start="1072" data-end="1094"><strong data-start="1076" data-end="1094">How This Works</strong></h3><ol data-start="1095" data-end="1811"><li data-start="1095" data-end="1453"><p data-start="1098" data-end="1123"><strong data-start="1098" data-end="1120"><code data-start="1100" data-end="1114">GivenFactors</code> CTE</strong>:</p><ul data-start="1127" data-end="1453"><li data-start="1127" data-end="1224">Creates a <strong data-start="1139" data-end="1158">temporary table</strong> containing the list of desired prime factors and their exponents.</li><li data-start="1228" data-end="1373">In this example, the input is:<pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1266" data-end="1373"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">plaintext</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-plaintext"><span>prime_id | exponent
---------|---------
2        | 3
5        | 1
</span></code></div></div></pre></li><li data-start="1377" data-end="1453">You can dynamically replace the <code data-start="1411" data-end="1419">SELECT</code> statements with different values.</li></ul></li><li data-start="1455" data-end="1667"><p data-start="1458" data-end="1484"><strong data-start="1458" data-end="1483"><code data-start="1460" data-end="1477">MatchingNumbers</code> CTE</strong>:</p><ul data-start="1488" data-end="1667"><li data-start="1488" data-end="1560">Joins <code data-start="1496" data-end="1510">PrimeFactors</code> with <code data-start="1516" data-end="1530">GivenFactors</code> on <code data-start="1534" data-end="1544">prime_id</code> and <code data-start="1549" data-end="1559">exponent</code>.</li><li data-start="1564" data-end="1667">Groups by <code data-start="1576" data-end="1587">number_id</code> and ensures it contains <strong data-start="1612" data-end="1624">at least</strong> all given factors using <code data-start="1649" data-end="1666">HAVING COUNT(*)</code>.</li></ul></li><li data-start="1669" data-end="1811"><p data-start="1672" data-end="1709"><strong data-start="1672" data-end="1708">Final <code data-start="1680" data-end="1688">SELECT</code> with <code data-start="1694" data-end="1706">NOT EXISTS</code></strong>:</p><ul data-start="1713" data-end="1811"><li data-start="1713" data-end="1811">Ensures the <code data-start="1727" data-end="1738">number_id</code> does not contain <strong data-start="1756" data-end="1765">extra</strong> prime factors beyond those in <code data-start="1796" data-end="1810">GivenFactors</code>.</li></ul></li></ol><hr data-start="1813" data-end="1816"><h3 data-start="1818" data-end="1839"><strong data-start="1822" data-end="1839">Example Usage</strong></h3><h4 data-start="1840" data-end="1906"><strong data-start="1845" data-end="1906">1. Finding <code data-start="1858" data-end="1869">number_id</code> for Prime Factors <code data-start="1888" data-end="1904">{(2,3), (5,1)}</code></strong></h4><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1907" data-end="2031"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">sql</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-sql"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">WITH</span> GivenFactors <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> (
    <span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> <span class="hljs-number">2</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> prime_id, <span class="hljs-number">3</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> exponent <span class="hljs-keyword">UNION</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">ALL</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>
)
<span class="hljs-comment">-- Same query as above</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre><h4 data-start="2032" data-end="2085"><strong data-start="2037" data-end="2085">2. Finding <code data-start="2050" data-end="2061">number_id</code> for <code data-start="2066" data-end="2083">{(7,2), (11,1)}</code></strong></h4><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="2086" data-end="2211"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">sql</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-sql"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">WITH</span> GivenFactors <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> (
    <span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> <span class="hljs-number">7</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> prime_id, <span class="hljs-number">2</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">AS</span> exponent <span class="hljs-keyword">UNION</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">ALL</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">SELECT</span> <span class="hljs-number">11</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>
)
<span class="hljs-comment">-- Same query as above</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre><hr data-start="2213" data-end="2216"><h3 data-start="2218" data-end="2271"><strong data-start="2222" data-end="2271">Alternative: Using Python for Dynamic Queries</strong></h3><p data-start="2272" data-end="2409">If you want to <strong data-start="2287" data-end="2319">build this query dynamically</strong> in Python using <code data-start="2336" data-end="2353">mysql.connector</code>, you can construct the <code data-start="2377" data-end="2391">GivenFactors</code> list dynamically.</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="2411" data-end="3791"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> mysql.connector

db_config = {
    <span class="hljs-string">'host'</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'localhost'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">'user'</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'your_user'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">'password'</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'your_password'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">'database'</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'your_database'</span>
}

prime_factors = [(<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>), (<span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>)]  <span class="hljs-comment"># Example input list</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">find_matching_number_id</span>(<span class="hljs-params">prime_factors</span>):
    conn = mysql.connector.connect(**db_config)
    cursor = conn.cursor()

    <span class="hljs-comment"># Build the GivenFactors table dynamically</span>
    given_factors_sql = <span class="hljs-string">" UNION ALL "</span>.join(
        <span class="hljs-string">f"SELECT <span class="hljs-subst">{pf[<span class="hljs-number">0</span>]}</span> AS prime_id, <span class="hljs-subst">{pf[<span class="hljs-number">1</span>]}</span> AS exponent"</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> pf <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> prime_factors
    )

    query = <span class="hljs-string">f"""
    WITH GivenFactors AS (<span class="hljs-subst">{given_factors_sql}</span>),
    MatchingNumbers AS (
        SELECT pf.number_id
        FROM PrimeFactors pf
        JOIN GivenFactors gf ON pf.prime_id = gf.prime_id AND pf.exponent = gf.exponent
        GROUP BY pf.number_id
        HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM GivenFactors)
    )
    SELECT mn.number_id
    FROM MatchingNumbers mn
    WHERE NOT EXISTS (
        SELECT 1 FROM PrimeFactors pf
        WHERE pf.number_id = mn.number_id
        AND (pf.prime_id, pf.exponent) NOT IN (SELECT prime_id, exponent FROM GivenFactors)
    );
    """</span>

    cursor.execute(query)
    result = cursor.fetchall()
    cursor.close()
    conn.close()

    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> [row[<span class="hljs-number">0</span>] <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> row <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> result]

<span class="hljs-comment"># Example Usage</span>
matching_numbers = find_matching_number_id([(<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>), (<span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>)])
<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"Matching Number IDs:"</span>, matching_numbers)
</span></code></div></div></pre><hr data-start="3793" data-end="3796"><h3 data-start="3798" data-end="3813"><strong data-start="3802" data-end="3813">Summary</strong></h3><p data-start="3814" data-end="4012"> <strong data-start="3816" data-end="3828">Flexible</strong>: Can dynamically check for any set of prime factors.<br data-start="3881" data-end="3884"> <strong data-start="3886" data-end="3899">Efficient</strong>: Uses <code data-start="3906" data-end="3912">WITH</code> CTEs to filter exact matches.<br data-start="3942" data-end="3945"> <strong data-start="3947" data-end="3967">Cross-Compatible</strong>: Works in <strong data-start="3978" data-end="3989">raw SQL</strong> or <strong data-start="3993" data-end="4011">Python scripts</strong>.</p><p data-start="4014" data-end="4091" data-is-last-node="">Would you like any modifications, such as indexing for better performance? </p></div></div></div></div><div class="mb-2 flex gap-3 empty:hidden -ml-2"><div class="items-center justify-start rounded-xl p-1 z-10 -mt-1 bg-token-main-surface-primary screen-arch:mt-1 md:absolute md:sr-only"><div class="flex items-center"><span class="" data-testid="conversation-turn-88" data-scroll-anchor="false"><h5 class="sr-only">You said:</h5><div class="m-auto text-base py-[18px] px-6"><div class="mx-auto flex flex-1 gap-4 text-base md:gap-5 data-testid="conversation-turn-90" data-scroll-anchor="false"><h5 class="sr-only">You said:</h5><div class="m-auto text-base py-[18px] px-6"><div class="mx-auto flex flex-1 gap-4 text-base md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 md:max-w-3xl lg:max-w-[40rem] xl:max-w-[48rem]"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col @xs/thread:px-0 @sm/thread:px-1.5 @md/thread:px-4"><div class="flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col flex-grow"><div data-message-author-role="user" data-message-id="ec4e6454-d7a9-45ca-bb63-e471fced2bbf" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 whitespace-normal break-words text-start [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden items-end rtl:items-start"><div class="relative max-w-[var(--user-chat-width,70%)] rounded-3xl bg-token-message-surface px-5 py-2.5"><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">import mysql.connector
import os

class DatabaseConnection:
    def __init__(self, db_config=None):
        self.db_config = db_config or self.get_default_db_config()
        self.conn = None

    def connect(self):
        if self.conn is None or not self.conn.is_connected():
            self.conn = mysql.connector.connect(**self.db_config)
        return self.conn
    
    def query(self, sql, params=None, commit=False):
        conn = self.connect()
        cursor = conn.cursor(dictionary=True)
        cursor.execute(sql, params or ())
        if commit:
            conn.commit()
        result = cursor.fetchall()
        cursor.close()
        return result
    
    def close(self):
        if self.conn and self.conn.is_connected():
            self.conn.close()
            self.conn = None

    @staticmethod
    def get_default_db_config():
        return {
            'host': os.getenv('DB_HOST', 'localhost'),
            'user': os.getenv('DB_USER', 'PFEN_Modify'),
            'password': os.getenv('DB_PASSWORD', ''),
            'database': os.getenv('DB_NAME', 'PFEN'),
            'unix_socket': os.getenv('DB_SOCKET', '/opt/local/var/run/mysql57/mysqld.sock'),
            'raise_on_warnings': True
        }

class NumberDB(DatabaseConnection):
    def get_number(self, number):
        sql = "SELECT * FROM numbers WHERE number = %s"
        result = self.query(sql, (number,))
        return result[0] if result else None
    
    def insert_number(self, number, total_factors, unique_factors):
        sql = """
        INSERT INTO numbers (number, total_factors, unique_factors)
        VALUES (%s, %s, %s) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE total_factors = VALUES(total_factors), unique_factors = VALUES(unique_factors)
        """
        self.query(sql, (number, total_factors, unique_factors), commit=True)

class PrimeDB(DatabaseConnection):

    def select_primes_from_db(self, limit):
        # Select and store  primes and their prime_ids  into prime_ids dictionary
        prime_lookup = dict()
        sql = "SELECT prime, prime_id FROM Primes WHERE prime &lt; %s"
        primes_query_result = self.query(sql, (limit,))
        # print(f"Primes below {limit}:")
        for prime, prime_id in prime_ids:
            # if prime_id &lt;= 10:
            #     print(f"ID: {prime_id}, Prime: {prime}")
            prime_lookup[prime] = prime_id
        return prime_lookup

    limit = 99999;
    prime_ids = select_primes_from_db(limit)

    def get_prime_by_sequence(self, sequence):
        sql = "SELECT * FROM primes WHERE sequence = %s"
        result = self.query(sql, (sequence,))
        return result[0] if result else None
    
    def insert_prime(self, sequence, prime, prime_gap):
        sql = """
        INSERT INTO primes (sequence, prime, prime_gap)
        VALUES (%s, %s, %s) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE prime = VALUES(prime), prime_gap = VALUES(prime_gap)
        """
        self.query(sql, (sequence, prime, prime_gap), commit=True)

class PrimeFactorDB(DatabaseConnection):
    def get_primefactors(self, number_id):
        sql = """
          SELECT n.number_id, n.number, pf.prime_id, p.prime, pf.exponent FROM Numbers n
          JOIN PrimeFactors pf ON n.number_id = pf.number_id
          JOIN Primes p ON pf.prime_id = p.prime_id
          WHERE pf.number_id = %s
        """
        result = self.query(sql, (number_id,))
        """ RETURN ALL FACTORS INSTEAD OF THIS ..."""
        return result if result else None
    
    def insert_primefactors(self, number_id, factors):
        sql = """
          SELECT n.number_id 
          FROM Numbers n
          JOIN PrimeFactors pf ON n.number_id = pf.number_id
          VALUES (%s, %s, %s)
        """

        """ LOOP OVER FACTORS """
        for prime_id, exponent in factors:
            self.query(sql, number_id, (prime_id, exponent), commit=True)

    def find_number_by_primefactors(self, prime_factors, ):
        primeid_factors = []
        for pf in prime_factors:
            primeid_factors.append( ( prime_ids[pf[0]], pf[1]) )
        # Build the GivenFactors table dynamically
        given_factors_sql = " UNION ALL ".join(
            f"SELECT {pf[0]} AS prime_id, {pf[1]} AS exponent" for pf in primeid_factors
        )
        sql = f"""
        WITH GivenFactors AS ({given_factors_sql}),
        MatchingNumbers AS (
            SELECT pf.number_id
            FROM PrimeFactors pf
            JOIN GivenFactors gf ON pf.prime_id = gf.prime_id AND pf.exponent = gf.exponent
            GROUP BY pf.number_id
            HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM GivenFactors)
        )
        SELECT mn.number_id
        FROM MatchingNumbers mn
        WHERE NOT EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 FROM PrimeFactors pf
            WHERE pf.number_id = mn.number_id
            AND (pf.prime_id, pf.exponent) NOT IN (SELECT prime_id, exponent FROM GivenFactors)
        );
        """
        self.query(sql, commit=True)
        result = cursor.fetchall()
        return result or None

    def find_number_by_primefactor_ids(self, primeid_factors, ):
        # Build the GivenFactors table dynamically
        given_factors_sql = " UNION ALL ".join(
            f"SELECT {pf[0]} AS prime_id, {pf[1]} AS exponent" for pf in primeid_factors
        )
        sql = f"""
        WITH GivenFactors AS ({given_factors_sql}),
        MatchingNumbers AS (
            SELECT pf.number_id
            FROM PrimeFactors pf
            JOIN GivenFactors gf ON pf.prime_id = gf.prime_id AND pf.exponent = gf.exponent
            GROUP BY pf.number_id
            HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM GivenFactors)
        )
        SELECT mn.number_id
        FROM MatchingNumbers mn
        WHERE NOT EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 FROM PrimeFactors pf
            WHERE pf.number_id = mn.number_id
            AND (pf.prime_id, pf.exponent) NOT IN (SELECT prime_id, exponent FROM GivenFactors)
        );
        """
        self.query(sql, commit=True)
        result = cursor.fetchall()
        return result or None













        """
SELECT n.number, GROUP_CONCAT(CONCAT(p.prime, '^', pf.exponent) SEPARATOR ' x ') AS factorization
FROM Numbers n
JOIN PrimeFactors pf ON n.number_id = pf.number_id
JOIN Primes p ON pf.prime_id = p.prime_id
GROUP BY n.number
ORDER BY n.number;

        ADD MODULE FOR CONVERTING PRIME FACTORS INTO A STRING
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):

        ADD MODULE TO ADD TWO PRIME FACTORS
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):

        ADD MODULE TO SUBTRACT TWO PRIME FACTORS
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):

        ADD MODULE FIND INTERSECTION OF TWO PRIME FACTORS
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):

        ADD MODULE FIND UNION OF TWO PRIME FACTORS
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):

        pfen_asjson   = for storage into database

        gcd           = Greatest Common Divisor (Intersection)
        lcm           = Lowest Common Multiple (Union)
        mult          = Multiplication (Vector Addition)
        div           = Multiplication (Vector Subtraction)
        exp           = Exponentation (Vector Multiplication)
        root          = Exponentation (Vector Division)
        is_root       = are all numbers in vector multiple of power of the root, sqrt =&gt; are all exponents even
        is_prime      = single point vector
        are_coprime   = ( number, number)

        prime_factors = list each prime and exponent
        prime_factoral = a vector of all ones, followed by all zeros

        """


# Function to easily get database instances
def get_number_db():
    return NumberDB()

def get_prime_db():
    return PrimeDB()

incorrectly references <code data-start="245" data-end="256">prime_ids</code> instead of iterating over <code data-start="283" data-end="304">primes_query_result</code>.</li><li data-start="308" data-end="693"><strong data-start="310" data-end="318">Fix:</strong><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="321" data-end="693"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">select_primes_from_db</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, limit</span>):
    prime_lookup = <span class="hljs-built_in">dict</span>()
    sql = <span class="hljs-string">"SELECT prime, prime_id FROM Primes WHERE prime &lt; %s"</span>
    primes_query_result = self.query(sql, (limit,))
    
    <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> row <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> primes_query_result:  <span class="hljs-comment"># Fix: Iterate over query result</span>
        prime_lookup[row[<span class="hljs-string">'prime'</span>]] = row[<span class="hljs-string">'prime_id'</span>]
    
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> prime_lookup
</span></code></div></div></pre></li></ul><h4 data-start="695" data-end="755"><strong data-start="700" data-end="755">1.2 <code data-start="706" data-end="736">self.query(sql, commit=True)</code> Incorrectly Used</strong></h4><ul data-start="756" data-end="1046"><li data-start="756" data-end="903"><strong data-start="758" data-end="768">Issue:</strong> <code data-start="769" data-end="799">self.query(sql, commit=True)</code> is used in <code data-start="811" data-end="840">find_number_by_primefactors</code>, but its a <strong data-start="853" data-end="869">SELECT query</strong>, so <code data-start="874" data-end="887">commit=True</code> is unnecessary.</li><li data-start="904" data-end="1046"><strong data-start="906" data-end="914">Fix:</strong> Remove <code data-start="922" data-end="935">commit=True</code> for SELECT queries:<pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="958" data-end="1046"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span>result = self.query(sql)  <span class="hljs-comment"># No commit required</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> result <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre></li></ul><h4 data-start="1048" data-end="1105"><strong data-start="1053" data-end="1105">1.3 <code data-start="1059" data-end="1078">cursor.fetchall()</code> Called on <code data-start="1089" data-end="1103">self.query()</code></strong></h4><ul data-start="1106" data-end="1424"><li data-start="1106" data-end="1278"><strong data-start="1108" data-end="1118">Issue:</strong> <code data-start="1119" data-end="1138">cursor.fetchall()</code> is already handled inside <code data-start="1165" data-end="1179">self.query()</code>, but in <code data-start="1188" data-end="1217">find_number_by_primefactors</code> and <code data-start="1222" data-end="1254">find_number_by_primefactor_ids</code>, it's used redundantly.</li><li data-start="1279" data-end="1424"><strong data-start="1281" data-end="1289">Fix:</strong> Remove <code data-start="1297" data-end="1316">cursor.fetchall()</code> in:<pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1323" data-end="1424"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 <span class="hljs-comment"># No need for an extra fetchall()</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> result <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre></li></ul><h4 data-start="1426" data-end="1473"><strong data-start="1431" data-end="1473">1.4 Error in <code data-start="1446" data-end="1467">insert_primefactors</code> SQL</strong></h4><ul data-start="1474" data-end="1934"><li data-start="1474" data-end="1557"><p data-start="1476" data-end="1557"><strong data-start="1476" data-end="1486">Issue:</strong> <code data-start="1487" data-end="1508">VALUES (%s, %s, %s)</code> is used incorrectly inside a <code data-start="1538" data-end="1546">SELECT</code> statement.</p></li><li data-start="1558" data-end="1934"><p data-start="1560" data-end="1658"><strong data-start="1560" data-end="1568">Fix:</strong> Change to <code data-start="1579" data-end="1657">INSERT INTO PrimeFactors (number_id, prime_id, exponent) VALUES (%s, %s, %s)</code>.</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1662" data-end="1934"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">insert_primefactors</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, number_id, factors</span>):
    sql = <span class="hljs-string">"INSERT INTO PrimeFactors (number_id, prime_id, exponent) VALUES (%s, %s, %s)"</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> prime_id, exponent <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> factors:
        self.query(sql, (number_id, prime_id, exponent), commit=<span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
</span></code></div></div></pre></li></ul><hr data-start="1936" data-end="1939"><h3 data-start="1941" data-end="1979"><strong data-start="1945" data-end="1979">2. Improvements &amp; Enhancements</strong></h3><h4 data-start="1980" data-end="2057"><strong data-start="1985" data-end="2057">2.1 Convert <code data-start="1999" data-end="2022">select_primes_from_db</code> to Run Once and Store the Result</strong></h4><ul data-start="2058" data-end="2389"><li data-start="2058" data-end="2164"><strong data-start="2060" data-end="2070">Issue:</strong> <code data-start="2071" data-end="2113">prime_ids = select_primes_from_db(limit)</code> runs at class definition time, which is not ideal.</li><li data-start="2165" data-end="2389"><strong data-start="2167" data-end="2175">Fix:</strong> Move it to <code data-start="2187" data-end="2199">__init__()</code><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="2202" data-end="2389"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">PrimeDB</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_ inherited__">DatabaseConnection</span>):
    <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):
        <span class="hljs-built_in">super</span>().__init__()
        self.prime_ids = self.select_primes_from_db(<span class="hljs-number">99999</span>)  <span class="hljs-comment"># Initialize once</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre></li></ul><h4 data-start="2391" data-end="2459"><strong data-start="2396" data-end="2459">2.2 Improve <code data-start="2410" data-end="2439">find_number_by_primefactors</code> for Dynamic Input</strong></h4><p data-start="2460" data-end="2544">Instead of using string formatting (<code data-start="2496" data-end="2511">f"SELECT ..."</code>), use <strong data-start="2518" data-end="2543">parameterized queries</strong>:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="2545" data-end="3268"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span>given_factors_sql = <span class="hljs-string">", "</span>.join([<span class="hljs-string">"(%s, %s)"</span>] * <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(primeid_factors))
values = [val <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> pair <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> primeid_factors <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> val <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> pair]

sql = <span class="hljs-string">f"""
WITH GivenFactors (prime_id, exponent) AS (
    VALUES <span class="hljs-subst">{given_factors_sql}</span>
),
MatchingNumbers AS (
    SELECT pf.number_id
    FROM PrimeFactors pf
    JOIN GivenFactors gf ON pf.prime_id = gf.prime_id AND pf.exponent = gf.exponent
    GROUP BY pf.number_id
    HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM GivenFactors)
)
SELECT mn.number_id
FROM MatchingNumbers mn
WHERE NOT EXISTS (
    SELECT 1 FROM PrimeFactors pf
    WHERE pf.number_id = mn.number_id
    AND (pf.prime_id, pf.exponent) NOT IN (SELECT prime_id, exponent FROM GivenFactors)
);
"""</span>
self.query(sql, values)
</span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="3269" data-end="3374"><strong data-start="3269" data-end="3277">Why?</strong>
 More secure (prevents SQL injection).<br data-start="3317" data-end="3320"> Handles <strong data-start="3330" data-end="3337">any</strong> number of prime factors dynamically.</p><hr data-start="3376" data-end="3379"><h3 data-start="3381" data-end="3408"><strong data-start="3385" data-end="3408">3. Summary of Fixes</strong></h3><p data-start="3409" data-end="3765"> <strong data-start="3411" data-end="3468">Fixed incorrect iteration over <code data-start="3444" data-end="3465">primes_query_result</code>.</strong><br data-start="3468" data-end="3471"> <strong data-start="3473" data-end="3530">Fixed unnecessary <code data-start="3493" data-end="3506">commit=True</code> for <code data-start="3511" data-end="3519">SELECT</code> queries.</strong><br data-start="3530" data-end="3533"> <strong data-start="3535" data-end="3592">Fixed <code data-start="3543" data-end="3551">VALUES</code> misplacement in <code data-start="3568" data-end="3589">insert_primefactors</code>.</strong><br data-start="3592" data-end="3595"> <strong data-start="3597" data-end="3665">Optimized <code data-start="3609" data-end="3632">select_primes_from_db</code> to run only once per instance.</strong><br data-start="3665" data-end="3668"> <strong data-start="3670" data-end="3765">Rewrote <code data-start="3680" data-end="3709">find_number_by_primefactors</code> with parameterized queries for security &amp; efficiency.</strong></p><p data-start="3767" data-end="3829" data-is-last-node="">Would you like any additional improvements or explanations? </p></div></div></div></div><div class="mb-2 flex gap-3 empty:hidden -ml-2"><div class="items-center justify-start rounded-xl p-1 z-10 -mt-1 bg-token-main-surface-primary screen-arch:mt-1 md:absolute md:sr-only"><div class="flex items-center"><span class="" data-end="186">To access <code data-start="10" data-end="21">prime_ids</code>, which is a dictionary storing prime numbers mapped to their <code data-start="83" data-end="93">prime_id</code> values, you need to ensure it is properly initialized and used within the class. Here's how:</p><hr data-start="188" data-end="191"><h3 data-start="193" data-end="234"><strong data-start="197" data-end="234">1. Ensuring Proper Initialization</strong></h3><p data-start="235" data-end="273">In your <strong data-start="243" data-end="262"><code data-start="245" data-end="254">PrimeDB</code> class</strong>, you have:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="274" data-end="343"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span>limit = <span class="hljs-number">99999</span>;
prime_ids = select_primes_from_db(limit)
</span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="344" data-end="486">However, this executes at the <strong data-start="374" data-end="400">class definition level</strong>, meaning it runs only once when the class is loaded, not when an instance is created.</p><h4 data-start="488" data-end="538"><strong data-start="493" data-end="538"> Correct Way: Initialize in <code data-start="524" data-end="536">__init__()</code></strong></h4><p data-start="539" data-end="578">Modify your <code data-start="551" data-end="560">PrimeDB</code> class as follows:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="579" data-end="1204"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">PrimeDB</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_ inherited__">DatabaseConnection</span>):
    <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):
        <span class="hljs-built_in">super</span>().__init__()  <span class="hljs-comment"># Initialize parent class</span>
        self.prime_ids = self.select_primes_from_db(<span class="hljs-number">99999</span>)  <span class="hljs-comment"># Store in instance variable</span>

    <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">select_primes_from_db</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, limit</span>):
        prime_lookup = {}
        sql = <span class="hljs-string">"SELECT prime, prime_id FROM Primes WHERE prime &lt; %s"</span>
        primes_query_result = self.query(sql, (limit,))
        
        <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> row <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> primes_query_result:
            prime_lookup[row[<span class="hljs-string">'prime'</span>]] = row[<span class="hljs-string">'prime_id'</span>]  <span class="hljs-comment"># Properly populate the dictionary</span>
        
        <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> prime_lookup  <span class="hljs-comment"># Returns {prime_number: prime_id}</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre><hr data-start="1206" data-end="1209"><h3 data-start="1211" data-end="1243"><strong data-start="1215" data-end="1243">2. Accessing <code data-start="1230" data-end="1241">prime_ids</code></strong></h3><p data-start="1244" data-end="1350">Since <code data-start="1250" data-end="1261">prime_ids</code> is now an <strong data-start="1272" data-end="1294">instance attribute</strong>, you must create an instance of <code data-start="1327" data-end="1336">PrimeDB</code> to access it:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1352" data-end="1631"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span>prime_db = PrimeDB()  <span class="hljs-comment"># Create instance of PrimeDB</span>
<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(prime_db.prime_ids)  <span class="hljs-comment"># Prints the dictionary of prime_id mappings</span>

<span class="hljs-comment"># Example: Getting the prime_id for prime number 13</span>
prime_id_for_13 = prime_db.prime_ids.get(<span class="hljs-number">13</span>)
<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">f"Prime ID for 13: <span class="hljs-subst">{prime_id_for_13}</span>"</span>)
</span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="1632" data-end="1795"> <strong data-start="1634" data-end="1695"><code data-start="1636" data-end="1647">prime_ids</code> is now accessible across all instance methods</strong> in <code data-start="1699" data-end="1708">PrimeDB</code>.<br data-start="1709" data-end="1712"> <strong data-start="1714" data-end="1735">Use <code data-start="1720" data-end="1733">.get(prime)</code></strong> to fetch a <code data-start="1747" data-end="1757">prime_id</code> safely (returns <code data-start="1774" data-end="1780">None</code> if not found).</p><hr data-start="1797" data-end="1800"><h3 data-start="1802" data-end="1849"><strong data-start="1806" data-end="1849">3. Using <code data-start="1817" data-end="1828">prime_ids</code> in <code data-start="1832" data-end="1847">PrimeFactorDB</code></strong></h3><p data-start="1850" data-end="1958">If <code data-start="1853" data-end="1868">PrimeFactorDB</code> needs access to <code data-start="1885" data-end="1896">prime_ids</code>, <strong data-start="1898" data-end="1927">pass a <code data-start="1907" data-end="1916">PrimeDB</code> instance</strong> when creating <code data-start="1942" data-end="1957">PrimeFactorDB</code>:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1960" data-end="2331"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">PrimeFactorDB</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_ inherited__">DatabaseConnection</span>):
    <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, prime_db</span>):
        <span class="hljs-built_in">super</span>().__init__()
        self.prime_ids = prime_db.prime_ids  <span class="hljs-comment"># Get prime_id dictionary</span>

    <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">find_number_by_primefactors</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, prime_factors</span>):
        primeid_factors = [(self.prime_ids[pf[<span class="hljs-number">0</span>]], pf[<span class="hljs-number">1</span>]) <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> pf <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> prime_factors]
        <span class="hljs-comment"># Use primeid_factors as before...</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="2333" data-end="2355">Now, use it like this:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="2356" data-end="2548"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span>prime_db = PrimeDB()  <span class="hljs-comment"># Create PrimeDB instance</span>
primefactor_db = PrimeFactorDB(prime_db)  <span class="hljs-comment"># Pass PrimeDB instance</span>
<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(primefactor_db.prime_ids)  <span class="hljs-comment"># Access prime_ids from PrimeDB</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre><hr data-start="2550" data-end="2553"><h3 data-start="2555" data-end="2570"><strong data-start="2559" data-end="2570">Summary</strong></h3><p data-start="2571" data-end="2755"> <strong data-start="2573" data-end="2624">Move <code data-start="2580" data-end="2591">prime_ids</code> initialization to <code data-start="2610" data-end="2622">__init__()</code></strong><br data-start="2624" data-end="2627"> <strong data-start="2629" data-end="2692">Access with <code data-start="2643" data-end="2670">self.prime_ids.get(prime)</code> to avoid key errors</strong><br data-start="2692" data-end="2695"> <strong data-start="2697" data-end="2753">Pass <code data-start="2704" data-end="2713">PrimeDB</code> instance to <code data-start="2726" data-end="2741">PrimeFactorDB</code> if needed</strong></p><p data-start="2757" data-end="2811" data-is-last-node="">Would you like further refinements or explanations? </p></div></div></div></div><div class="mb-2 flex gap-3 empty:hidden -ml-2"><div class="items-center justify-start rounded-xl p-1 z-10 -mt-1 data-testid="conversation-turn-96" data-scroll-anchor="false"><h5 class="sr-only">You said:</h5><div class="m-auto text-base py-[18px] px-6"><div class="mx-auto flex flex-1 gap-4 text-base md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 md:max-w-3xl lg:max-w-[40rem] xl:max-w-[48rem]"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col @xs/thread:px-0 @sm/thread:px-1.5 @md/thread:px-4"><div class="flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col flex-grow"><div data-message-author-role="user" data-message-id="6784bac8-6a92-4dc8-9fae-a48eacc9fe08" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 whitespace-normal break-words text-start [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden items-end rtl:items-start"><div class="relative max-w-[var(--user-chat-width,70%)] rounded-3xl bg-token-message-surface px-5 py-2.5"><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">import mysql.connector
import os

class DatabaseConnection:
    def __init__(self, db_config=None):
        self.db_config = db_config or self.get_default_db_config()
        self.conn = None

    def connect(self):
        if self.conn is None or not self.conn.is_connected():
            self.conn = mysql.connector.connect(**self.db_config)
        return self.conn
    
    def query(self, sql, params=None, commit=False):
        conn = self.connect()
        cursor = conn.cursor(dictionary=True)
        cursor.execute(sql, params or ())
        if commit:
            conn.commit()
        result = cursor.fetchall()
        cursor.close()
        return result
    
    def close(self):
        if self.conn and self.conn.is_connected():
            self.conn.close()
            self.conn = None

    @staticmethod
    def get_default_db_config():
        return {
            'host': os.getenv('DB_HOST', 'localhost'),
            'user': os.getenv('DB_USER', 'PFEN_Modify'),
            'password': os.getenv('DB_PASSWORD', ''),
            'database': os.getenv('DB_NAME', 'PFEN'),
            'unix_socket': os.getenv('DB_SOCKET', '/opt/local/var/run/mysql57/mysqld.sock'),
            'raise_on_warnings': True
        }

class NumberDB(DatabaseConnection):
    def get_number(self, number):
        sql = "SELECT * FROM numbers WHERE number = %s"
        result = self.query(sql, (number,))
        return result[0] if result else None
    
    def insert_number(self, number, total_factors, unique_factors):
        sql = """
        INSERT INTO numbers (number, total_factors, unique_factors)
        VALUES (%s, %s, %s) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE total_factors = VALUES(total_factors), unique_factors = VALUES(unique_factors)
        """
        self.query(sql, (number, total_factors, unique_factors), commit=True)

class PrimeDB(DatabaseConnection):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.prime_ids = self.select_primes_from_db(99999)  # Initialize once

    def select_primes_from_db(self, limit):
        # Select and store  primes and their prime_ids  into prime_ids dictionary
        prime_lookup = dict()
        sql = "SELECT prime, prime_id FROM Primes WHERE prime &lt; %s"
        primes_query_result = self.query(sql, (limit,))
        for row in primes_query_result:
            prime_lookup[row['prime']] = row['prime_id']
        return prime_lookup

    def get_prime_by_sequence(self, sequence):
        sql = "SELECT * FROM primes WHERE sequence = %s"
        result = self.query(sql, (sequence,))
        return result[0] if result else None
    
    def insert_prime(self, sequence, prime, prime_gap):
        sql = """
        INSERT INTO primes (sequence, prime, prime_gap)
        VALUES (%s, %s, %s) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE prime = VALUES(prime), prime_gap = VALUES(prime_gap)
        """
        self.query(sql, (sequence, prime, prime_gap), commit=True)

class PrimeFactorDB(DatabaseConnection):
    def get_primefactors(self, number_id):
        sql = """
          SELECT n.number_id, n.number, pf.prime_id, p.prime, pf.exponent FROM Numbers n
          JOIN PrimeFactors pf ON n.number_id = pf.number_id
          JOIN Primes p ON pf.prime_id = p.prime_id
          WHERE pf.number_id = %s
        """
        result = self.query(sql, (number_id,))
        """ RETURN ALL FACTORS INSTEAD OF THIS ..."""
        return result if result else None
    
    def insert_primefactors(self, number_id, factors):
        sql = """
          INSERT INTO PrimeFactors (number_id, prime_id, exponent)
          VALUES (%s, %s, %s)
        """
        for prime_id, exponent in factors:
            self.query(sql, (number_id, prime_id, exponent), commit=True)

    def find_number_by_primefactors(self, prime_factors, ):
        prime_db = PrimeDB()
        primeid_factors = []
        for pf in prime_factors:
            primeid_factors.append( ( prime_db.prime_ids[pf[0]], pf[1]) )
        # Build the GivenFactors table dynamically
        given_factors_sql = " UNION ALL ".join(
            f"SELECT {pf[0]} AS prime_id, {pf[1]} AS exponent" for pf in primeid_factors
        )
        sql = f"""
        WITH GivenFactors AS ({given_factors_sql}),
        MatchingNumbers AS (
            SELECT pf.number_id
            FROM PrimeFactors pf
            JOIN GivenFactors gf ON pf.prime_id = gf.prime_id AND pf.exponent = gf.exponent
            GROUP BY pf.number_id
            HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM GivenFactors)
        )
        SELECT mn.number_id
        FROM MatchingNumbers mn
        WHERE NOT EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 FROM PrimeFactors pf
            WHERE pf.number_id = mn.number_id
            AND (pf.prime_id, pf.exponent) NOT IN (SELECT prime_id, exponent FROM GivenFactors)
        );
        """
        result = self.query(sql)
        return result or None

    def find_number_by_primefactor_ids(self, primeid_factors, ):
        # Build the GivenFactors table dynamically
        given_factors_sql = ", ".join(["(%s, %s)"] * len(primeid_factors))
        values = [val for pair in primeid_factors for val in pair]
        sql = f"""
        WITH GivenFactors (prime_id, exponent) AS (
            VALUES {given_factors_sql}
        ),
        MatchingNumbers AS (
            SELECT pf.number_id
            FROM PrimeFactors pf
            JOIN GivenFactors gf ON pf.prime_id = gf.prime_id AND pf.exponent = gf.exponent
            GROUP BY pf.number_id
            HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM GivenFactors)
        )
        SELECT mn.number_id
        FROM MatchingNumbers mn
        WHERE NOT EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 FROM PrimeFactors pf
            WHERE pf.number_id = mn.number_id
            AND (pf.prime_id, pf.exponent) NOT IN (SELECT prime_id, exponent FROM GivenFactors)
        );
        """
        result = self.query(sql, values)
        return result or None

        """
        ADD MODULE FOR CONVERTING PRIME FACTORS INTO A STRING
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):
        ADD MODULE TO ADD TWO PRIME FACTORS
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):
        ADD MODULE TO SUBTRACT TWO PRIME FACTORS
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):
        ADD MODULE FIND INTERSECTION OF TWO PRIME FACTORS
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):
        ADD MODULE FIND UNION OF TWO PRIME FACTORS
    def primefactors(self, number_id, ):
        pfen_asjson   = for storage into database
        gcd           = Greatest Common Divisor (Intersection)
        lcm           = Lowest Common Multiple (Union)
        mult          = Multiplication (Vector Addition)
        div           = Multiplication (Vector Subtraction)
        exp           = Exponentation (Vector Multiplication)
        root          = Exponentation (Vector Division)
        is_root       = are all numbers in vector multiple of power of the root, sqrt =&gt; are all exponents even
        is_prime      = single point vector
        are_coprime   = ( number, number)
        prime_factors = list each prime and exponent
        prime_factoral = a vector of all ones, followed by all zeros
        """

# Function to easily get database instances
def get_number_db():
    return NumberDB()

def get_prime_db():
    return PrimeDB()

def get_primefactor_db():
    return PrimeFactorDB()</div><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-full top-0 -mr-3.5 hidden pr-5 pt-1 [.group\/conversation-turn:hover_&amp;]:block"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button 20.1542 3.01362 19.8356L3.80288 15.1C3.9742 14.0721 4.46243 13.1234 5.19932 12.3865L13.2929 4.29291ZM13 7.41422L6.61353 13.8007C6.1714 14.2428 5.87846 14.8121 5.77567 15.4288L5.21656 18.7835L8.57119 py-[18px] px-6"><div class="mx-auto flex flex-1 gap-4 text-base md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 md:max-w-3xl lg:max-w-[40rem] xl:max-w-[48rem]"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn @xs/thread:px-0 @sm/thread:px-1.5 @md/thread:px-4"><div class="flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col flex-grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="928003c6-cad4-4d81-8a4d-6882be350a4e" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 whitespace-normal break-words text-start [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="202">With the modification to <code data-start="25" data-end="40">PrimeFactorDB</code> to accept a <code data-start="53" data-end="62">PrimeDB</code> instance, you should adjust <code data-start="91" data-end="120">find_number_by_primefactors</code> to use <code data-start="128" data-end="144">self.prime_ids</code> instead of creating a new <code data-start="171" data-end="180">PrimeDB</code> instance. Here's how:</p><hr data-start="204" data-end="207"><h3 data-start="209" data-end="254"><strong data-start="213" data-end="254">Updated <code data-start="223" data-end="252">find_number_by_primefactors</code></strong></h3><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="255" data-end="1364"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">find_number_by_primefactors</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, prime_factors</span>):
    <span class="hljs-comment"># Convert prime numbers to their corresponding prime_id using self.prime_ids</span>
    primeid_factors = [(self.prime_ids[pf[<span class="hljs-number">0</span>]], pf[<span class="hljs-number">1</span>]) <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> pf <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> prime_factors]

    <span class="hljs-comment"># Build the GivenFactors table dynamically</span>
    given_factors_sql = <span class="hljs-string">", "</span>.join([<span class="hljs-string">"(%s, %s)"</span>] * <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(primeid_factors))
    values = [val <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> pair <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> primeid_factors <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> val <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> pair]

    sql = <span class="hljs-string">f"""
    WITH GivenFactors (prime_id, exponent) AS (
        VALUES <span class="hljs-subst">{given_factors_sql}</span>
    ),
    MatchingNumbers AS (
        SELECT pf.number_id
        FROM PrimeFactors pf
        JOIN GivenFactors gf ON pf.prime_id = gf.prime_id AND pf.exponent = gf.exponent
        GROUP BY pf.number_id
        HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM GivenFactors)
    )
    SELECT mn.number_id
    FROM MatchingNumbers mn
    WHERE NOT EXISTS (
        SELECT 1 FROM PrimeFactors pf
        WHERE pf.number_id = mn.number_id
        AND (pf.prime_id, pf.exponent) NOT IN (SELECT prime_id, exponent FROM GivenFactors)
    );
    """</span>

    result = self.query(sql, values)
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> result <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>
</span></code></div></div></pre><hr data-start="1366" data-end="1369"><h3 data-start="1371" data-end="1394"><strong data-start="1375" data-end="1394">Changes &amp; Fixes</strong></h3><ol data-start="1395" data-end="1768"><li data-start="1395" data-end="1470"> <strong data-start="1400" data-end="1470">Uses <code data-start="1407" data-end="1423">self.prime_ids</code> instead of creating a new <code data-start="1450" data-end="1459">PrimeDB</code> instance</strong></li><li data-start="1471" data-end="1568"> <strong data-start="1476" data-end="1568">Ensures prime numbers in <code data-start="1503" data-end="1518">prime_factors</code> are correctly mapped to their <code data-start="1549" data-end="1559">prime_id</code> values</strong></li><li data-start="1569" data-end="1660"> <strong data-start="1574" data-end="1660">Uses parameterized queries (<code data-start="1604" data-end="1632">VALUES {given_factors_sql}</code>) to prevent SQL injection</strong></li><li data-start="1661" data-end="1768"> <strong data-start="1666" data-end="1768">Efficiently passes values as a flat list using <code data-start="1715" data-end="1766">[val for pair in primeid_factors for val in pair]</code></strong></li></ol><hr data-start="1770" data-end="1773"><h3 data-start="1775" data-end="1793"><strong data-start="1779" data-end="1793">How to Use</strong></h3><p data-start="1794" data-end="1861">Make sure <code data-start="1804" data-end="1819">PrimeFactorDB</code> is initialized with a <code data-start="1842" data-end="1851">PrimeDB</code> instance:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1862" data-end="2145"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">python</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-python"><span>prime_db = PrimeDB()
primefactor_db = PrimeFactorDB(prime_db)

prime_factors = [(<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>), (<span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>)]  <span class="hljs-comment"># Example input: (prime number, exponent)</span>

data-testid="conversation-turn-100" data-scroll-anchor="false"><h5 class="sr-only">You said:</h5><div class="m-auto text-base py-[18px] px-6"><div class="mx-auto flex flex-1 gap-4 text-base md:gap-5 class="flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col flex-grow"><div data-message-author-role="user" data-message-id="eba6bb22-03d0-499d-b629-5e9983347c70" dir="auto" class="min-h-8             VALUES (1, 1), (2, 1), (3, 1)' at line 1</div><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-full top-0 -mr-3.5 hidden pr-5 pt-1 [.group\/conversation-turn:hover_&amp;]:block"><span class=""
